summary: Ernestine G. Johnson was an employee of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA), later referred to as the Select Committee on Assassinations (SCAS). Payroll and certification reports from October 1977 to January 1979 document her employment, listing her name, social security number, position, and salary. These records indicate her involvement with the committee during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
significance: Medium. Ernestine G. Johnson's significance lies in her documented employment with the HSCA/SCAS during the JFK assassination investigation. While the specific nature of her role is not detailed, her presence on payroll and certification reports across multiple documents suggests she was a staff member involved in the committee's operations.
